planet.name: Kepler-35(AB) b
KIC 9837578 b
Kepler-35 b
planet.description: Kepler-35(AB) b is a planet orbiting two sub solar-mass stars which are in a binary (therefore the name with AB). The Kepler team estimates that approximately 1% of all close binary stars have planets. This yields a galactic population of at least several million.
planet.imagedescription:
This is an artists conception of the planet Kepler-35 b orbiting a binary star.
Illustration by Lynette Cook, http://extrasolar.spaceart.org.
